info.name: Friends Media
info.description:
## Friends Media (Social media ) web application

Social media is an internet-based form of communication. Social media platforms allow users to have conversations, share information and create web content. There are many forms of social media, including  
blogs, micro-blogs, wikis, social networking sites, photo-sharing sites, instant messaging, video-sharing sites, podcasts, widgets, virtual worlds, and more.

item.name: Authentication Routes

request.description:
## Verify User

After registering new User, OTP sent to the user's registered email id.

### Request body fields

*   userId
*   otp - which is sent to user's mail id

## Change Email ID

User can change Email ID in the Email verification page.

### Request body Fields

*   userId
*   email - New email id

## Login User

Users who are not verified will get verification pending response, verified users only will get a Bearer token in the response body

### Request Body

*   username
*   password
    

### Response Body

*   success: true
*   Bearer : "Bearer "+ token

## Facebook oAuth login

This route will redirect the user to facebook login page. After user verified by facebook authentication, the user will be redirected to Home page

item.description:
*   Register New user
*   Login User
*   Verify email
*   Change Email

item.name: Protected Routes
User

request.description:
#### Response Body

*   Id
*   name
*   username
*   bio
*   email
*   profilePic

## Response with all other Users except current User

### Response Body Array of users with:

*   name
*   username
*   profilePic

### Request Body

*   profilePic
*   name
*   bio
    

### Response Body

*   Success: status
*   user: updated user data

### Search element in url parameter

Example: search_element = "dog" => url = "/user/search/"+search_element

item.description:
#### Protected sub routes in user routes

*   Get current user Details
*   Get all other Users except current user
*   Update user details
*   Get all followers for current user
*   Get all followings for current user
*   Search by username and hashtag

item.name: Post

request.description:
### Request Body

*   image: base64 strin
*   caption
*   hashtag
    

### Response

*   success: status
*   post: created post

response.name: Create Post
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "post": {
        "_id": "62e4e8f975919079b7b40fac",
        "image": "Image in base64 format",
        "caption": "caption of the post",
        "author": {
            "_id": "62e4e7ee75919079b7b40f90",
            "name": "Updated name",
            "profilePic": "NEW profile pic in base64 format",
            "username": "ak_test"
        },
        "likes": [],
        "comments": [],
        "createdAt": "2022-07-30T08:16:57.796Z",
        "updatedAt": "2022-07-30T08:16:57.796Z",
        "__v": 0
    },
    "likes": [],
    "comments": []
}

item.name: Get all posts for the user

request.description:
### Response body

*   success: status
*   posts: all the posts by current user and the posts of following user

response.name: Get all posts for the user

request.description:
### Response

*   success: status
*   posts: Response with all the posts by the current user

response.name: Fetch current user's post

request.description:
### Delete the post

Attach the post ID as a parameter in the in the URL

#### Example: /post/deletePost/POSTID

response.name: Delete User post
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "deletedPost": {
        "_id": "62e4e8f975919079b7b40fac",
        "image": "Image in base64 format",
        "caption": "caption of the post",
        "author": "62e4e7ee75919079b7b40f90",
        "likes": [],
        "comments": [],
        "createdAt": "2022-07-30T08:16:57.796Z",
        "updatedAt": "2022-07-30T08:16:57.796Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

request.description:
### Request URL

*   attach post ID in URL example: /post/updatePost/POSTID
    

### Request Body:

*   caption
*   hashtag
    

### Response Body:

*   success: status
*   updatedPost

### Request URL

*   Attach post ID in URL example: /post/updatePost/POSTID
    

### Response Body

*   success: true/false
*   operation: like/dislike

### Request URL

*   Attach post ID in URL example: /post/updatePost/POSTID
    

### Request Body

*   comment - Content of the comment
    

### Response Body

*   success: true/false
*   post: post with updated comments

item.description:
### Protected Sub routes in Post Route

*   Create post
*   Get all post
*   Get Current user post
*   Delete post
*   Update post
*   Like
*   Comment

item.name: Friends

request.description:

*   Attach user ID to follow in URL example: /post/updatePost/USERID
    

### Response Body

*   operation: follow/unfollow

item.description:
#### All the Protected Routes should have the Bearer token attached to the request header, valid user will get the authorized users will get response. If user has invalid token or expired token he/she will get unauthorized as response.

*   User Routes
*   Post Routes
*   Friends Routes
*   Chat Routes
